title-code.title: RFP/DB: VOLAR Barracks - CEP Renovation (Sources Sought)

title-code.status-text: Market Survey - Letters of interest from HUBZone - Certified 8a and Service Disabled Veteran Owned Businesses to Owner February 24 at 3:00 PM (CST)

title-code.stdin-text: The Government is seeking qualified, experienced sources capable of
performing the design and construction for the whole block
revitalization of the west 39000 block, to include Barracks Buildings
renovation of laundry facilities in each barracks, replacement of
distribution piping, water and sewer lines to all buildings within the
west 39000 block, sidewalk replacement, parking lot reconfiguration and
reconstruction, and landscaping. All barracks shall be designed and
constructed to house one soldier per room under normal conditions, but
the design shall also support two soldiers per room under surge
conditions. This project includes the demo of chilled water and steam
piping to all buildings supported by the CEP and replacement with a
condenser water loop system for ground source heat pumps in the
barracks and a heating water loop for domestic hot water. This project
also requires providing 40% domestic hot water with solar for the
barracks and solar water heating at the central energy plant for the
heating water loop. Provisions shall be made for future connection of
Headquarters Building 39021 and 39022 to the new condenser water loop.

title-code.status-text: Sub & material bids to Construction Manager on Bid Package III-Building Finish Out February 19 at 2 PM (CST)

title-code.stdin-text: science classroom addition- athletic support addition - renovations -
new soccer field with parking -football field upgrades -restroom and
concession stand at athletic field - new competition gym - concrete
foundation - masonry exterior walls - steel roof joist - metal roof
deck

title-code.proj-text: GCWE09-- NOTE: . Subcontractors are invited to attend a Pre-proposal
Conference for the project on February 5, 2014 at 3:00PM at Reagan
High School, 19000 Ronald Reagan Drive, San Antonio, TX 78258 in the
cafeteria with a Site visit to follow. Attendees must check in at the
main office upon arrival. The 2011-Bond Reagan High School Bid Package
III Building Finish-Out Project provides for Construction of the
complete Building finish-out for the new science classroom Addition,
campus athletic facility Addition ReNovations, and athletic field
restroom/ concession Building. Project components include; Demolition;
erosion control Installation/maintenance; miscellaneous concrete,
masonry, and steel work; carpentry, millwork, and science lab
casework; waterproofing, insulation, roofing, doors, frames,
hardware, storefront/curtain wall systems, Building furnishings;
resilient resinous flooring, tile, drywall, ceilings, painting,
specialties, and Building Window Treatments; athletic equipment, gym
bleachers, and scoreboards; mechanical, electrical, plumbing, fire
protection, fire alarm, and elevator systems; Site work, drainage,
Site utilities, hardscape, asphalt Paving, and landscape/irrigation;
competition football field turf, drainage, irrigation system
Replacement.

factor-published-notes.published-note: Email ID : achaudoir@joeris.com Internet Addr : www.joeris.com BID DAY

title-code.status-text: GC Bids to Owner March 4 at 2:00 PM (CST)

title-code.stdin-text: Work consists of construction of a transit plaza, Primo Circle, a core
and shell building (for future build out), a 5,900 sf multi-purpose
building, a conditioned waiting building, improved amenities
(real-time arrival signs, plaza seating, illumination, bicycle racks),
a tower, an underground water storage system, pavers, a tree bosque,
and historical signage. Trades include selective demolition, concrete,
masonry, metals, wood, plastics, and composites, thermal and moisture
protection, openings, finishes, specialties, furnishings, fire
suppression, plumbing, mechanical, electrical, communications,
electronic safety and security, earthwork, exterior improvements,
utilities, electrical power generation.

title-code.title: RFQ/DB: Band Hall and Other Various Projects DESIGN BUILD

title-code.status-text: Statements of Qualifications for Design Build firms to Owner February 21 until 2:00 PM (CST)

title-code.stdin-text: JFK High Band Hall will be 12,000-13,000 square feet free standing
building with two rehearsal halls, large ensemble/small
ensemble/practice rooms; support spaces; common spaces, required
plumbing, mechanical, electrical, fire department and life safety
systems for additions and improvements to tie into existing
facilities; related site work; Priority 2 - 2014 EISD K-12
Improvements, both new construction and renovation as to be determined
on various campuses and EISD facilities

title-code.proj-text: CRWE14 - There will be a non-mandatory pre-proposal conference held on
Thursday, February 13, 2014, at 10:00 am in the 1st floor conference
room at the Edgewood I.S.D. Central Administration Offices located at
5358 W. Commerce St., San Antonio, Texas 78237. All vendors are
strongly encouraged to attend to clarify any questions in response to
RFQ.

summary.copyright: Copyright @ 2014 The McGraw-Hill Companies. Service is only for internal use by subscriber pursuant to contract.

title-code.title: Central Park - Park Operations Facility Conversion

title-code.status-text: Reporting consultant - Preliminary studies underway - Construction scheduled for 2015 pending funding

title-code.stdin-text: The former Texas Air National Guard Station, located in Central Park,
will be renovated for relocation of the Parks Operations Division.
Until a thorough evaluation can be conducted, it is assumed extensive
work will need to be done to all or part of the following major
building systems: HVAC, plumbing, roofing, installation of City
network, phone, radio antennae for City trunk radio, and controls for
automatic irrigation; general security improvements including cameras,
fencing, and lighting improvements.
